definition: pork strips stir-fried with yuxiang 魚香|鱼香[yu2 xiang1]
fragrant/sweet smelling/aromatic/savory or appetizing/(to eat) with relish/(of sleep) sound/perfume or spice/joss or incense stick/CL:根[gen1]
meat/flesh/pulp (of a fruit)/(coll.) (of a fruit) squashy/(of a person) flabby/irresolute/Kangxi radical 130
silk/thread/trace/(cuisine) shreds or julienne strips/CL:條|条[tiao2]/classifier: a thread (of cloud, smoke etc), a bit, an iota, a hint (of sth) etc

sentences.english: Have sailed the seven seas water, fish-flavored pork with chicken drumstick.
sentences.chinese: 曾经沧海难为水，鱼香肉丝配鸡腿。

sentences.english: Some of the famous dishes are pork shreds with fish seasoning, chicken cubes with chili peppers, and spicy braised crucian carp.
sentences.chinese: 一些著名的菜肴如鱼香肉丝，辣子鸡丁，干烧鲫鱼。

sentences.english: Kung Pow chicken, Yuxiang shredded pork and tomatoes fried with egg.
sentences.chinese: 宫保鸡丁，鱼香肉丝还有西红柿炒鸡蛋。

sentences.english: She likes Yuxiangrousi. She like cholocate too.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢吃鱼香肉丝，还喜欢吃巧克力。

definition: mapo tofu/stir-fried beancurd in chili sauce
Sichuan poached sliced fish in hot chili oil

yuxiang, a seasoning of Chinese cuisine that typically contains garlic, scallions, ginger, sugar, salt, chili peppers etc (Although "yuxiang" literally means "fish fragrance", it contains no seafood.)
dish consisting of stir-fried potato, eggplant and green pepper
duck's blood and beef tripe in spicy soup
